intro: Gamolepis trifurcata, commonly known as the three-branched mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along its stems. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its berries, which are usually red or yellow, contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Gamolepis trifurcata is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in forest canopies.
